title: Gimli
subtitle: Obstinate Visitor
game_text:
Fellowship. Damage +1.
Regroup: Exert an Elf ally whose home site is 6 and add (1) to heal Gimli.
lore: "'I will go forward free,' he said, 'or I will go back and seek my own land, where I am known to be true of word, though I perish alone in the wilderness.'"

title: Gimli
subtitle: Son of Glóin
game_text:
Damage +1.
Skirmish: Exert Gimli to make him strength +2.
lore: "There was a younger dwarf at Glóin's side: his son Gimli."

title: Gimli's Battle Axe
game_text:
Bearer must be Gimli.
He is damage +1.
Each time Gimli wins a skirmish, you may wound an Orc.
lore: "Beside them Gimli stood with his stout legs apart, wielding his dwarf-axe."

title: Citadel of the Stars
game_text:
Fortification. Plays to your support area.
Skirmish: Exert a (Gondor) Man or spot 3 knights to transfer this condition from your support area to a minion skirmishing a (Gondor) Man.
lore: The city of Osgiliath was the first capital of Gondor.

title:
Stronger and More
Terrible
game_text:
To play, add a threat.
Each time your (Gondor) wraith wins a skirmish, you may remove a threat.
lore: "'And lo! In the darkness of Mordor my hope rose...'"

title: Hollin Snarler
game_text:
Tracker. Fierce.
When you play this minion, you may spot a (Sauron) search card and X wounds on a companion (except the Ring-bearer) to add (X).

title: Smeagol
subtitle: Bearer of Great Secrets
game_text:
Ring-bound. To play, add a burden.
Each time the fellowship moves, place an unbound companion in the dead pile.
Regroup: If Smeagol is the Ring-bearer, add 2 burdens to discard each minion.
lore: "'...he used it to find out secrets, and he put his knowledge to crooked and malicious uses.'"

title: Rumil
subtitle: Elven Protector
game_text:
Archer.
Archery: Exert Rumil to wound an Orc.
lore: Brother to Haldir, Rumil guards the northern marches of the Golden Wood.

title: Weland
subtitle: Smith of the Riddermark
game_text:
Villager.
Discard Weland if an opponent controls his home site.
Fellowship: Exert Weland to heal a mounted companion.
lore: A tender of horses, Weland found much work at Helm's Deep.
